textList.name: START_BEACON_REBEL
textList.text: This sector was bustling with activity just a few years ago. Now, more than half of the jump beacons have been destroyed, many settlements have been abandoned and the Rebels patrol constantly.
This sector was hit hard by the rebellion. The many alien settlements and stations located here are now watched over by almost an equal number of Rebel bases, heavy-handedly 'keeping the peace'.
Once the Federation forces were scattered, the Rebels came down hard on the locals here. Between the 'tax collectors' and military bases, the Rebel presence in this sector is high.
At one point this was one of the most commonly traveled sectors. Knowing that, the Rebels have stationed a number of fleets here. Be careful.
You will have to be very cautious in this sector. The Rebels have full control and are no doubt looking for you.

You have reached the Rebel sector. The war with the Federation has affected the entire infrastructure of this place: everything here now serves the Rebels. Vigilant patrols fly all throughout, so don't expect to pass through without a fight.

This sector was captured by the rebellion specifically to cut off your path to the Federation base. Your crew give one another a fearful glance, but return to their stations ready to work. You may be able to get through yet.
There are Rebels ahead of you, and Rebels behind you, a bit too much arrogance as of late...
In this sector, Rebels are in charge — everywhere there is devastation, desolation, and roaming patrols of "liberators". This is what awaits the Federation, if you do not succeed in your mission.
You are in enemy territory. Extra caution won't hurt. That is of course, if you don't seek to attract the Rebels to you...
Once this was a peaceful trade sector, but everything changed when the Rebels arrived. Now their ships dart everywhere in search of Federation supporters, and you risk running into one of them.

textList.name: STORE_REBEL
textList.text: You discover a re-supply station used by Rebels and civilians alike. You transmit your fake ship identification and for once, they don't seem to recognize your ship. You try to assume the air of a local as you prepare to dock.
You arrive at a small space station that is putting out wide-band broadcasts on black-market channels. You doubt they would turn away any business, regardless of allegiances.
You receive generic advertisements from a nearby public ship-yard. It seems they are willing to work on any ship, not only those of Rebel hue.

textList.name: NOTHING_REBEL
textList.text: You enter a system bustling with Rebel activity. Supply freighters and re-supply stations are dwarfed by a few heavy warships. Luckily, no one seems to be paying attention to small cruisers. No ships are scanning or messaging you.

You arrive near a small Rebel refueling depot. Your ship is being scanned multiple times so they must recognize you, but there appears to be no combat-ready ships in the vicinity. The only message you receive is a denial to your request to dock at the depot.
There is not much of interest nearby. A small sun in the distance with a few orbiting planets in nearby space provide little of interest.

There are no other ships near this beacon, however you detect a small communication relay. You tap into it without a problem; there is no encryption. Most of the chatter revolves around troop and fleet movements, not particularly interesting.
There is a small planet nearby with scattered settlements. A small Rebel fleet is in orbit with many ships ferrying back and forth. It must be a more recently 'liberated' planet.

textList.name: REBEL_AUTO
textList.text: You discover one of the Rebel's autonomous scouts. The ship's AI wastes no time in engaging your ship.
Your ship is hailed: "This is an automated message. Resisting our takeover is pointless. Prepare to die." It appears this Rebel ship is run by an AI.
A Rebel autonomous scout is exploring this beacon. You attempt to hide behind a nearby moon, but the ship finds you and begins its assault.
The AI of a nearby small Rebel scout immediately identifies you as a threat and engages.
A Rebel ship moves in to engage. You attempt to open communications, but realize the futility of that action when you see the ship is run by an AI.
This must be one of the Rebels' unmanned scout ships. Looks like there's no way around a fight.
Another unmanned ship patrols this area. You prepare the ship for combat.
This beacon is being patrolled by a unmanned scout. A fight is unavoidable.
A small shuttle appears on the local radar. Turns out it is a Rebel automated scout!

event.name: AUTO_HACKER
event.text: Your arrival is greeted by numerous computer alerts. The nearby automated Rebel scout has used a local satellite to deploy a virus to disrupt your Shields System. Hopefully it won't cause further problems before you can destroy it.
Your hacking system automatically counters the digital assault and you move in to fight the ship.

textList.name: REBEL
textList.text: Your ship is hailed. "We've found you at last. Prepare to die!"
A small Rebel ship is docked at a small station. You try to lay low but it spots you. Power up the weapons!
A Rebel ship has been patrolling this region. As soon as you arrive it begins its assault.
A Rebel ship hails you: "Federation scum! We've waited a long time for this!"
You receive a transmission: "Sorry sir, this is nothing personal but we're under orders." The Rebel ship's weapons go hot.
By the time you notice the Rebel ship behind the beacon, it's too late to avoid a fight.
A Rebel ship hails. "We did not fight a war to let a single Federation ship shatter our dreams of a better galaxy!" He locks weapons.
A Rebel ship approaches cautiously. "Personally," says the captain, "I'd have stuck with the Federation. But I'm a soldier, sir, and I'm no use without a war to fight. Raise your shields!"
You're hailed by a Rebel ship: "When the rebellion is complete you'll see the safer world we provide. Well, you won't, but you get the point." They arm weapons.
A Rebel ship is guarding this beacon. You order a pursuit course and prepare to scratch up one more.

event.name: SQUAT_WARNING
event.text: You stumble across a forward scout of the Rebel fleet.

event.name: AUTO_CIVILIAN
event.text: You come across a Rebel automated scout ship pursuing a civilian ship, weapons engaged.
You power up your weapons and engage the automated ship.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range.

event.name: SQUAT_REFUEL_STATION
event.text: You detect a Rebel scout on an attack approach to a small refueling outpost. Their weapons are charged, but they're not firing yet.
The rebel responds to your threat, "I don't know who you are, but no one defies the Rebel Fleet!" They move in to engage.
The Rebel ship fires some warning shots but eventually powers down their weapons. The outpost seems to have given them what they demanded.

event.name: AUTO_REFUEL_STATION
event.text: You detect an automated Rebel scout attacking a small refueling outpost.
Detecting the higher threat, the automated ship moves in to engage your ship.
You steer clear of the conflict. The outpost receives a beating but the ship stops its attack before it's destroyed.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_MAP
event.text: You detect a Rebel automated ship nearby. It does not engage and seems to be patrolling around a long-range sensor station.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the sensor station.
(Advanced Sensors) Use your sensors to attempt to access the data.
(Teleporter) Beam directly onto the station to try to avoid detection.

event.text: Once on board, your crew is able to access and download the long-range scanner's archived information. Your map has been updated.
Your improved Sensors are able to remotely access and download the public radar station's local map data.
The automated ship must be remotely connected to the station; as soon as you attempt to log on, the ship activates and charges you.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_ITEM
event.text: An advanced Rebel automated ship remains stationed near a small Rebel space-station. Sensors indicate it's a storage vessel for military goods.

choice.text: Attack the automated ship to get to the storage cache.
(Cloaking) Attempt to cloak and access the cache.

event.text: The ship patrols wide around the area, successfully approaching the station while avoiding detection.
Before you can get close enough to scan the station, the automated ship detects you and moves in to attack!
The station was either abandoned or stripped clean. It seems to have lain unused for quite some time. You find nothing useful.
The station was apparently designed to outfit Rebel ships with Drone Systems. You find a functioning Schematic.
The station is a storage site for military grade weapons. You find one that can be easily attached to the ship.
The station is a storage site for various resources. You salvage everything possible.

event.name: AUTO_DEFENSE_RADAR
event.text: A Rebel automated ship sits dormant near a Rebel forward radar station.
The ship powers up and targets you.

choice.text: Keep your distance and wait for the FTL to charge.
(Combat Drone) Send a drone to distract the automated ship.

event.text: Your combat drone attacks the automated ship and then retreats, luring it away. You quickly move up to the radar station to access it.
Your combat drone repeatedly fires at the automated ship. It can't break through its shields, but is at least enough of a distraction to allow you to access the radar station.
Before your drone has a chance to attack, the automated ship activates and shoots it down. It then detects your ship and moves in on your position.
You successfully hack into their system and transmit false information about your location. That should hold off the fleet for a while.
You successfully hack into their system and transmit false information about your location. That should significantly hold off the fleet pursuit.
The firewalls prove too difficult to bypass. As you are about to disconnect, you stumble across unprotected information about the surrounding beacons. Your map is updated.
You are unable to penetrate the computer's defenses. You give up and return to the ship.
As you attempt to hack in, you set off a hidden alarm system. It seems that now the Rebels must surely be aware of your position! You hasten back to the ship to jump away.

event.name: REBEL_TRANSPORT
event.text: You spot a small Rebel ship nearby. It seems to have been re-fitted for transport rather than combat. It does not seem to want to engage you and your ship.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.
You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
Они предлагают вам содержимое своих трюмов, чтобы вы оставили их в покое.

choice.text: У них точно есть больше, в атаку!

event.text: Они с облегчением передают вам припасы и быстро уходят.
You search the ship and discover that its cargo was new military-grade weaponry! It was somehow undamaged in the fight and can easily be mounted on the ship.
You search the remains of the ship, but only come across blueprints and debris from broken machinery. A shame, but you take what scrap you can salvage.
The ship was transporting weaponry. You find a piece still intact, despite the battle.
The ship was apparently transporting weaponry; however, nothing seems to have survived the battle.
Searching the remains, you find that the cargo was military-grade drone schematics! You bring them aboard to install in your ship.
The debris implies that the ship was carrying drone schematics, but unfortunately nothing remains. You do find functioning drone parts, however.
This ship's cargo was not salvageable. However, they seem to have been surveying the region; they possess detailed maps and data. You download what you can to the ship's map.
From the bits and pieces you find, you decide that this ship was gathering information. Nothing seems useful.
You detect faint life signatures from an intact piece of the hull. They were transporting prisoners, and the sole survivor offers to join your crew, as a first step on his path to get revenge.
The ship appears to have been transporting prisoners. Unfortunately they were all killed in the battle. You salvage what you can.
The ship was carrying military supplies. You pick up anything that looks salvageable from the debris.
With the crew dead, you search the ship. You find military-grade weaponry and take what looks most useful.
The ship refuses to fight, but you still detect life signatures. Apparently this was a prisoner transport. The single survivor offers to join your crew in exchange for their freedom.
This ship was apparently carrying information about the surrounding beacons. You download what you can to the ship's map, and scrap the rest of the ship.
Searching the remains you find that the cargo was military-grade drone schematics! You bring them aboard to install on your ship.

event.name: BROKEN_REBEL_DRONE
event.text: You find a Rebel automated scout floating near this beacon. Despite its pristine condition, it appears to be de-activated.

choice.text: Attempt to download the ship's data stores, and then dismantle it for scrap.
Don't risk activating it, and just strip the ship for any useful scrap.

event.text: You are able to pull all of the ship's data about this sector. Your map has been updated.
You accidentally reactivate the ship's AI. Its weapons immediately go online; prepare for a fight!
Your advanced sensors indicate that it's safe to hack into the drone. You upload its map data to your navigation system and strip the ship of useful materials.
Your advanced sensors indicate the ship is on standby, ready to activate at a moment's notice. Will you still attempt to access the ship's data?
You leave the ship alone and prepare to jump.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_BOARDING
event.text: There appear to be a number of small stations nearby. Before you have time to scan them, warnings go off. A Rebel teleporter was used in one of the stations. You've been boarded!

textList.name: BOARDERS_REBEL_SHIP
textList.text: You receive a message from a nearby Rebel station, "You have a lot of guts passing through our space, I'll give you that." He turns giving an order, "Kill their crew, I want that ship intact."

Your sensors warn of an incoming Rebel ship at the same time as you hear the telltale signs of a teleporter. You hear someone taunt from within the ship, "Ready to die? I sure am ready to get a promotion!"
Incoming message, "Hello Captain," says a Rebel in an officer's garb. "How very generous of you to turn yourself in. Prepare to be boarded. Come quietly and we may be lenient."
You receive a message on a low-band channel. "You're surrounded, just like the last of your Federation friends. Just die already." The enemy has teleported onto your ship!

event.name: FLAGSHIP_CONSTRUCTION
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find yourself in a huge Rebel shipyard, scaffolding and construction drones filling the sector! The entire system looks devoted to ship construction, the nearby planets and moons ruthlessly mined to harvest resources for a ship of immense size...

Warning lights flash as scans identify the gigantic ship under construction - it's a second Rebel Flagship! This must be the secret shipyards where the first one was built, and you've accidentally stumbled across it! Even in its weakened state, the Rebel ship powers up... get ready, you've got a hell of a fight on your hands.
You feel the mission is the highest priority and it's too risky to stay in such a dangerous location.

event.name: FLAGSHIP_CONSTRUCTION_DONE
event.text: While the second flagship was not yet finished, it doesn't make the battle any less of a victory... and you've crippled the Rebel fleet's strength considerably! While you don't overstay your welcome, you quickly salvage choice bits of metal, drones, and even an unusual object or two from the wreckage and prepare to jump!

As you are leaving you detect an interesting Federation ship signal. Apparently the Rebels were reverse engineering the advanced weaponry on a prototype Federation cruiser. You don't know how they captured the ship intact but you program its FTL drive to return the ship to the nearest Federation base. You just hope it gets there unharmed.
event.unlockShip: The Federation Cruiser has been unlocked and added to the hangar!

deadCrew.text: You detect no more lifesigns on the incomplete Flagship. You'd expect a ship of that size to have more security measures, but perhaps their computer systems aren't complete yet.

textList.name: START_BEACON_ORDEN
textList.text: You arrive in the sector of the Order. After the outbreak of conflict, because of the clashes between the Federation and the Rebellion, their strength significantly thinned out. However, they still pose a threat.
This sector houses the main forces of the Order of Chaos. Their representatives are famous for their low adequacy and high aggressiveness.
This sector is under the control of religious fanatics. There are unverified rumors that when creating ships, the fanatics seal living people into their systems.

This place is the sector of the Order of Chaos. At present, their priority is the return to their former power and wealth. Robbery skirmishes with them are increasingly frequent, they do not take trespassers kindly.
The Order has its own unique technologies. However, entering trade negotiations is not within their creed...

The Order of Chaos was originally a sect that worshipped the god of Chaos. However, the religious themes have taken a back seat to their main source of revenue: barbaric raids on neighbouring systems.
The people of the Order are known to worship fire. It is also known that during their raids, devoted fanatics are ready to give up their lives for the glory of the Order.

You arrive in an Order sector. The core planets are devoid of life and means of shelter, so the fanatics live in huge planet-stations. If necessary, they can even make hyperspace jumps for short distances.
The Order's ships are fast and have excellent weaponry, which obliterate their enemies into ashes. Use extreme caution traversing their territory.
A few years ago, a coalition between Federation forces of the Zoltan and Engi sharply put forward a theme of fighting against the fanatics, as the robbery attacks dealt huge blows to their economies.
The Order sector can be a dangerous place. Without proper equipment, one can only find death from their interceptors. In addition, they don't respond well to guests.

In this sector, there aren't any inhabitable planets, they were all exhausted by excessive extraction of resources. Followers of the Order live in huge man-made planet-stations, built in those times when their native planets were rich in metal.

textList.name: NOTHING_ORDEN_TEXT
textList.text: The jump leads you to nothing but empty space. The local beacon serves only as a reference point for routing a path through the sector.
You jump into an unremarkable system. There aren't any signs of life within scanning range.
Your jump leads to an entirely ordinary binary star system. Only thing around is empty space.
You jump leads to a remarkable binary star system. The view is amazing, but that's about it.
Your jumps opens to an empty beacon. It's strange that it's so calm here...
Your jump leads to beacon next to a lifeless planet. It's pretty quiet here...
You are near a gigantic Order jump beacon. Suprisingly, you aren't greeted by a single swarm of their interceptors.

textList.name: BOARDERS_ORDEN_CLEAR_TEXT
textList.text: Immediately upon exiting the jump, a squad of thugs teleports from a giant planet-station. They also spread incendiary mixtures into the ship's ventilation system, igniting fires throughout the ship.
Literally out of nowhere, crazed Order fanatics appear on your ship! They also spread incendiary mixtures into the ship's ventilation system, igniting fires throughout the ship.

You find yourself near a gigantic Order jump beacon, and one of their assault teams teleports on board your ship! They also spread incendiary mixtures into the ship's ventilation system, igniting fires throughout the ship.

textList.name: BOARDERS_ORDEN_ASTEROID_TEXT
textList.text: Immediately upon exiting the jump, a group of thugs teleports on board. You'll have to fight them right in the asteroid field!
You register a surge of energy activity coming from the largest asteroid nearby, followed by crazed Order fanatics teleporting on board!
You find yourself near a giant Order jump beacon in the middle of the asteroid field, and one of their assault crews teleports aboard your ship!

textList.name: BOARDERS_ORDEN_SHIP_TEXT
textList.text: An Order ship rushes right towards you, and from the jump beacon nearby a boarding party teleports aboard!

You are contacted by the captain of the fanatical ship: "I will burn your ship to the name of the gods of Chaos!!! And do not even try to escape!" Meanwhile, the telltale sounds of teleportation are heard — Battle Stations!

textList.name: ORDEN_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: As soon as you appear at the beacon, an Order cruiser flies toward you from the nearest planet-station — battle cannot be avoided!
You almost fly right into an Order ship patrolling this beacon. The short transmission reads: "Cursed heretics, you will be burned in the name of Chaos!"
The giant mechanical planet near this beacon means one thing — you've gotten too close to an Order settlement. The approaching battle cruiser confirms your fears.
Your jump exits you right outside an Order settlement. A battlecruiser wastes no time for words and opens fire on you.
You don't have any time to jump: an Order ship takes off in your direction from the nearest planet-station. A battle is inevitable.
The beacon is completely empty, except for an Order cruiser, who, right after seeing you, immediately goes on the offensive.
"To the glory of Chaos!" is the only thing you hear as soon as you appear at the beacon. An Order cruiser is attacking you!
A lone Order ship patrols this beacon. You try to contact them, but they reject the request as they charge up their weapons.
You appear too close to an Order crusier, your scanners intercept a scrap of communication from their ship: "...wherever you came from, Chaos shall swallow you!"
Upon exiting the beacon, you see an Order battlecruiser lying in wait. The satisfied smirk of their captain on the vid-screen doesn't bode well: "Now you will know the true power of Chaos!"

event.text: The pirate quickly grants you the list of their goods, while continuing to nervously scan the surrounding space.
You cut communications and charge your weapons.
You cut communications and prepare to jump.

textList.name: STORE_ORDEN_TEXT
textList.text: The pirate ship hails: "Hmm... you don't look like one of these psychopaths, perhaps I could sell you something. What do you think?"
A nearby pirate ship is not in any hurry to start a fight with you. They offer to sell you "some equipment", clearly not obtained by the most honest means.

You stumble upon a pirate cruiser, it's unknown how it turned up in this place. You don't have time to charge up your weapons as you get a message from them: "Take it easy, take it easy, guys! We just want to make some money by selling you some of our extra equipment. How's that sound?"

textList.name: STORE_ORDEN_JUST_STORE_TEXT
textList.text: A desperate pirate ship has put a shop together in this place. They must be making a very good profit, since they've opened the store under the very nose of the Order.
You are welcomed by an automated trade station. Strange, there isn't any staff to be seen around at all.
An old Mantis, no longer able to fight, has opened up their shop in this place. Why don't the servants of the Order bother them?

textList.name: DISTRESS_BEACON_ORDEN_ITSATRAP_TEXT
textList.text: From the comms you hear: "It's very nice that you answer every call for help." The Order ship flying around clearly doesn't have any good intentions towards you.
From the comms you hear: "It's very nice that you answer every call for help." The Order ship flying around clearly doesn't have any good intentions towards you.
The Order ship opens comms: "Welcome to hell, Captain!" It's a trap!
The Order ship opens comms: "Welcome to hell, Captain!" It's a trap!
You were in such a hurry to find the source of the distress signal, that you almost didn't evade a projectile fired in your direction. It's an ambush!
You were in such a hurry to find the source of the distress signal, that you almost didn't evade a projectile fired in your direction. It's an ambush!
Unfortunately, the distress signal turned out to be bait. An Order battlecruiser is already en route to intercept, charging up its weaponry.
Unfortunately, the distress signal turned out to be bait. An Order battlecruiser is already en route to intercept, charging up its weaponry.

textList.name: DISTRESS_BEACON_ORDEN_ITSAHELP_TEXT
textList.text: On this beacon, you find burnt wreckage of a civilian ship with its emergency beacon still on. It'd be a shame to let this go to waste, so you collect all that's left.
On this beacon, you find burnt wreckage of a civilian ship with its emergency beacon still on. It'd be a shame to let this go to waste, so you collect all that's left.
Next to you are remains of an Order ship with its emergency beacon still on. You find something of value from them and take it, they aren't going to miss it.
Next to you are remains of an Order ship with its emergency beacon still on. You find something of value from them and take it, they aren't going to miss it.
Arriving at the distress signal, you have time to notice an Order cruiser jumping away. A heap of debris is all that remains of their victim.
Arriving at the distress signal, you have time to notice an Order cruiser jumping away. A heap of debris is all that remains of their victim.
You hurry to help as soon as you can, but it's too late. A pile of smoldering debris is all that remains of a civilian ship after meeting with Order forces.
You hurry to help as soon as you can, but it's too late. A pile of smoldering debris is all that remains of a civilian ship after meeting with Order forces.

textList.name: SUN_HOSTILE_ORDEN_TEXT
textList.text: Near the active star, you notice an Order ship. And it notices you. Here's the encounter!
The ship next to this star was doing some research. Evidently, your appearance has greatly hindered them.
Jumping out next to the hot star, you notice an Order ship. It seems that it was stuck here without fuel, and your appearance has presented a chance of salvation for them.
The Order cruiser is in orbit of a hot class M star. Having noticed your appearance, they move in to intercept.
The jump beacon near which you appeared is too close to a class M super-giant. The situation is complicated by an Order cruiser, which is rapidly approaching you.

choice.text: Hide in the nearest dust cloud.

textList.name: NEBULA_HOSTILE_ORDEN_TEXT
textList.text: A silhouette of a lone Order ship flashes ahead of you in the nebula. Fortunately, they have not noticed you yet.
Nearby, you can make out the silhouette of one of the fanatics' ships.
You fly into the nebula, noticing an Order ship inside, but your scanners are unable to determine its classification.
You find yourself in a dense cloud of the nebula. A bit ahead of you looms an Order cruiser. The ship's type is not yet discernable.
An Order cruiser lurks inside a dense portion of the nebula. Fortunately, you've noticed it before it's got the chance to spot you. However, it's unclear what kind of ship it is.
Despite the low visibility in the nebula, you have time to spot the silhouette of an Order ship before it's discovered you.

event.text: As soon as you hide an Order ship notices you and moves in to engage.
You quickly hide. Now is not the best time for battle.
You quickly hide. Now is not the best time for battle.
You quickly hide. Now is not the best time for battle.
You go to meet up with them, and the Order ship begins charging its vast arsenal.
You go to meet up with them, and the Order ship begins charging its vast arsenal.
You go to meet up with them, and the Order ship begins charging its vast arsenal.
Suddenly, a dense, dense cloud of gas causes you to slow down to a crawl. When it dissipates, you find that there's no one in front of you anymore...

event.name: ITEM_ORDEN_BOX_FOR_HUMAN
event.text: You find a box engraved with Order markings and an ammunition symbol. It seems that the locking mechanism is stuffed with explosives, and on the other side of the container you detect a touch sensor.

choice.text: Attempt to break into the box.
Have one of your crewmembers make their way to the touch panel.

event.text: Being a fool is not within our regulations. You throw the box back out into the emptiness of space.
An explosion is heard, and one of your crew is smeared upon the walls of the room. Who will wash this?

removeCrew.text: Before you know it, your dead crewmember arrives with a bucket and a mop...

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
An explosion is heard, and one of your crew is smeared upon the walls of the room. Who will wash this?

removeCrew.text: Before you know it, your dead crewmember arrives with a bucket and a mop...

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
An explosion is heard, and one of your crew is smeared upon the walls of the room. Who will wash this?

removeCrew.text: Before you know it, your dead crewmember arrives with a bucket and a mop...

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.
The detonation mechanism fails, so you calmly open the box.

event.name: ITEM_ORDEN_BOX_FOR_HUMAN_SCAN
event.text: Who will go to open the container?
Your human touches the detector box and the sensor lights green — the lid is open.

event.name: BOOM_ENGI
event.text: Your Engi touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

event.name: BOOM_ENERGY
event.text: Your Zoltan touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

event.name: BOOM_MANTIS
event.text: Your Mantis touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

event.text: Your Rockman touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

event.text: Your Lanius touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

event.text: Your Crystal touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

event.text: Your Avatar touches the detector, and the container's sensors light up red. At the same moment an explosion is heard, which obliterates the poor fellow to shreds.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the clonebay successfully creates a copy of the dead crewmember.

You prepare to take apart this insolent piece of metal.

There is absolutely nothing remarkable about this nebula. This is the most boring place in the whole sector.
You peer into the surrounding space, but do not see anything unusual.
A pair of nuts and bolts hits the glass of the pilot's cockpit, but nothing else happens.
No matter how beautiful these iridescent gas-dust clouds are, you need to move on...

The fanatics have already left, but the civilians are in critical condition — their hull has almost collapsed and most of the rooms are set ablaze. It's not safe to go to their aid.
You cold-bloodedly disconnect the connection and prepare to leave. Your crew seems to be upset, but you assure them that nothing could be done.

The beacon's empty, but in the distance you notice a fanatics' ship, slowly approaching your position.
Only a lonely dying planet adorns this beacon. In the next instant, you notice an Order cruiser contrasting its dark side. You've got only a few seconds to make a decision.

choice.text: Let them deal with their own problems.

event.text: "You have helped us out greatly with this information! We cannot repair your ship, so here, take these supplies." You thank them and say goodbye.

The ship you were escorting thanks you, and the caravan of civilian ships releases a group of repair drones in your direction. After a couple minutes the ship looks as good as new, or at least, in much better condition.

event.name: ORDEN_CRAZY_HEAL_ENGI
event.text: An Engi ship jumps to the beacon right after you: "No time to explain! Federation assistance! Quick, shutdown your engines and wait for the bombs!"

escape.text: You notice that they've started charging their engines.

gotaway.text: The strange ship disappears, leaving you at a loss for words...

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect a bit of scrap.

deadCrew.text: With all the Engi dead, you dock with their ship, completely clearing out its holds.

event.text: You find a strange device on their ship. Perhaps it will come in handy.

event.name: ORDEN_DREDNOUT_QUEST
event.text: Right before you is the Order Flagship, armed to the teeth. Without another word, they direct all their weapons towards you.

destroyed.text: The flagship of the Order is destroyed. You collect its pieces and among them you find a surviving weapon.

deadCrew.text: The crew of the flagship of the Order are all dead. You take everything of value from their ship, including a weapon that survived the battle.

textList.name: START_BEACON_HAL
textList.text: This sector is patrolled by unmanned HAL ships. Several centuries ago, the artificial HAL intelligence killed off the race that created it. Since then, the drones have uncontrollably multiplied and filled out a significant portion of the Galaxy.

The artificial HAL intelligence controls this sector of the Galaxy. The race that created them fell many centuries ago in the war with its creations. Since then, the HAL have been capturing more and more territories.
No one quite remembers where exactly the artificial HAL intelligence came from. However, it poses a threat to all life in the Galaxy. Care should be taken when flying through this system.
This sector is inhabited by HAL drones — an artificial intelligence that kills all life around. It won't be that easy to get to this system's exit.

The creators of the artificial HAL intelligence first fell into war with them. Since then, many centuries have passed, but no one has been able to exterminate the HAL completely, though such attempts have been made...

Unmanned spacecraft under the leadership of the HAL AI have inhabited this sector for many centuries; it seems that the passage of time has no power over them. However, the same cannot be said about the race that spawned the HAL...

textList.name: HAL_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: You barely have time to evade a huge asteroid flying off your starboard side — there is a new threat — the HAL drone is already releasing combat drones towards you!
A HAL drone patrols near this beacon. After seeing you, they immediately power up their combat systems. Battle Stations!
A predatory HAL drone flies towards you, pulsating its red "eye". Prepare to fight!
The red outline of a ship looms in the distance. It starts to approach, and you distinguish that it's another HAL drone, immediately turning to attack!

There's a beautiful view from the window. Wait, something's not right... After a couple of seconds, you realize that the panorama is being spoiled by an approaching HAL drone, clearly with hostile intentions.
Another empty beacon. Oh nevermind — On the screen you see a HAL drone, preparing to fight you!
Jumping out near the beacon, you immediately fall under the bombardment of a HAL drone. Ready your defenses!
Directly before you flies a HAL drone, and you have no doubts about its hostile intentions...
A HAL drone patrols this beacon's vicinity. Seeing you, it immediately attacks.
You hardly dodge a direct collision with a HAL drone. Actually, it scratched your ship's paint! Not to worry though, a lot of scrap will remain from the drone to pay for the paint.
There's absolutely nothing special about this beacon. As such, you go to talk to one of your crew, when suddenly a HAL drone appears out of nowhere to attack you!

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect all that survives.

textList.name: STORE_HAL_1_TEXT
textList.text: An automated trade station welcomes you at this beacon. You wonder how it's managed to survived this sector's chaos.
An automated trade station invitingly flashes advertising lights. Now it's time to take a breather and fix up.
Right in front of you stands an automated trade station. It might be worth a look — maybe you'll find something worthwhile.

textList.name: LOW_ITEMS_HAL_TEXT
textList.text: In front of you lies the broken hull of some ship. Inside you find some supplies.
A pile of rubbish hangs still in space near the beacon. Probably the remains from a past battle.
You find the torn up hull of a Rebel cruiser. Even they have a hard time here... You take everything of value you can salvage from their ship.
You stumble upon the remains of a space station that has been long destroyed. However, you manage to find something of use from the forgotten debris.

textList.name: MED_ITEMS_HAL_TEXT
textList.text: You stumble upon the wreckage of two ships, from which you determine the outline of a HAL drone and a Rebel cruiser. Evidently, neither of them won the fight... You take of everything of use from the battlefield.
Directly in front of you floats a heap of debris. It seems that it's composed of the remains of two or three ships, one of which probably belonged to the Rebels. You clean it out without remorse.
A pile of debris nearby appears to be the remnants of a Federation cruiser. It's sad to witness such a sight, but there's nothing to be done, except to collect everything salvageable from the wreck.

Next to a nearby small asteroid field hangs the wreckage of a Rebel cruiser. Apparently, the pilot lost control and their ship got shot down by asteroids. You carefully remove supplies from their ship and give the order to fly away from the asteroids.

textList.name: NEBULA_HAL_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: Another nebula, another HAL drone to meet you. A fight is inevitable.
Within a dense cloud of nebula hides a HAL ship. Seeing you, it sends out a pack of combat drones.
The nebula around you blinds you to notice the imminent danger — a HAL ship sneaks up on you and sends out a bunch of combat drones.
In the nebula you notice a pulsating red "eye". This HAL drone is targeting you with its artillery!
The nebula around is so dense that you can't see anything. After a few minutes of wandering blindly, you suddenly cross paths with a HAL drone!
Scanners can't display what's happening around, the nebula's too dense. A HAL appears out of nowhere and immediately enters combat mode.
Taking advantage of the nebula, a HAL drone is able to get close enough to within firing range of you, a battle is unavoidable!
The nebula around is empty. You give the order to prepare to jump, but suddenly an unmanned HAL craft appears and confuses your plans.
Suddenly a HAL drone emerges from the nebula. Ready your defenses!
You almost collide with a HAL ship in the dense gas cloud. Turning, it goes on the offensive.
A HAL ship was waiting to ambush you, hidden by the gas clouds. There isn't time to retreat, prepare to fight!

textList.name: NOTHING_HAL_1
textList.text: You expect to stumble on some hostile drones, but all is quiet.
The beacon is empty, you see neither HAL ships nor anything else of any significance.
Your crew gets ready to repel any attack, but everything is peaceful here and nothing comes.
The jumps exits out to an absolutely unremarkable system. There isn't anybody around whatsoever.
Another beacon welcomes you with its emptiness. At least you have a chance here to catch your breath a little.

event.text: You activate your weapons and rush in to attack the drone.
You try to stay out of its sight, and manage to escape it without hazard.

textList.name: HAL_NEUTRAL_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: You notice the danger in time — a HAL drone is hidden behind a huge asteroid drifting nearby.
In the distance you notice the familiar lights indicative of the HAL. It's flying an opposite course from you, but if you want you could catch up to it.
In the distance looms the HAL. While it's still far away, you have time to make a decision.
In the distance, a HAL's lights dimly flash, but as every moment passes it gets brighter. The drone approaches...
Looks like the beacon is empty, but then you notice the approaching lights of a HAL ship. How will you proceed?
A HAL drone is moving nearby on a parallel course. It doesn't seem to take any notice of you.
You notice a HAL drone patrolling in the distance. There's an opportunity to avoid the battle altogether.

event.name: HAL_BOSS_FIGHT
event.text: You cautiously approach a huge HAL repair yard. A drone in the center is busy repairing smaller drones. A few more drones are scurrying around, waiting for their turn to be repaired.

You rush into the attack, relying on the element of surprise. However, the HAL 9000 reacts to your attack just in time. The waiting repair drones prefer to fly away rather than get destroyed by your attack.
You try to stay out of its sight. HAL 9000 is too preoccupied with its work and doesn't notice your presence.

choice.text: (Avatar Crewmember) Your Avatar can forge your ship's ID's to match HAL signatures. Disguise yourself and stand in line for repairs.

destroyed.text: After destroying the ship, you manage to find a weapon that survived the explosion.

HAL 9000 detects you as weak and gives you the repair drone.

event.text: Near the beacon you find an abandoned warehouse on the surface of a lone asteroid.

choice.text: Linger and thoroughly search the whole warehouse.
Without wasting any time, quickly search the warehouse.

event.text: You set explosives along the perimeter of the warehouse.

choice.text: Do not touch anything and fly away instead.

event.text: A Federation ship's captain said that after the last jump he had no fuel left, and feels heavily dizzy from this ion storm. They ask if you can spare them some fuel and escort them to their destination.
You give the captain a little fuel and they give you the coordinates of the location they need to get to.
You apologize to them and move on.

event.name: ASTEROID_I_FORGOT_YOU_MAN_2
event.text: The Federation ship comes out of the jump immediately after you, but, to your surprise, it's charging its weapons, right on your tail!

choice.text: Make several maneuvers to shake off the pursuer.

event.text: You deftly loop past large asteroids, dodging projectiles, but the pursuit doesn't stop.
The captain of the Federation ship doesn't respond to your hails... Apparently they've gone mad!
You contact the captain and explain that he have mistaken everything. Apparently, jumping adversely affects their consciousness. After apologizing, the captain asks: "How can I thank you?"
The captain throws up his hands — he does not have excess fuel... however, there is a bit of metal.
The captain gives you missiles and a bit of scrap.
The captain gives you drone parts and a bit of scrap.

destroyed.text: After destroying the ship, you collect everything of value.

deadCrew.text: No one's left alive on the ship, so you collect everything of value.

event.text: Suddenly one of your Engi crew-members begins to spark and freezes in place. It seems that due to some sort of virus they are no longer in control of themselves...
...after a couple of seconds the Engi's head explodes...

removeCrew.text: Attempts to clone the dead crewmember fail to succeed. The virus has completely obliterated your crewmember...

event.name: HAL_FED_NOFUEL

choice.text: Give them fuel and escort them.

event.text: You ship over a few fuel cells and prepare to jump.

event.name: QUEST_HAL_FED_NOFUEL
event.text: "Captain, thank you for accompanying us! However, this is not the place. We made a mistake and went to the wrong beacon. But now we have figured it out, and we have the exact coordinates! And yes, by the way, we have empty tanks again... What do you say?"
They take your fuel and give a signal that they are ready to continue.
You decide that among these asteroids the Federation will never know about your methods. Attack!
The ship comes out of the jump after you. "Captain, thank you for saving us! Hold on, have everything we've got!"

event.name: HAL_HUNTRADE
event.text: As soon as you exit the jump, a pirate fighter aims their weapons at you, but stops and hails: "Hold on! This isn't another stupid drone... We have a couple of drones for sale, care to buy any?"

event.text: You come out of the jump near a stationary HAL ship, but a crewman says that something is amiss, that this drone is not like the others...
The ship responds to your aggression by activating all of its systems.
This ship can be dangerous. You're wise enough to fly off to a safe distance.

choice.text: (Lanius Crewmember) Your Lanius feels friendly signals coming from the drone and requests you to send them out to investigate.

event.text: Your Lanius arrives at the the drone and gnaws through the remnants of the workings of the ship equipment, and is surprised to find some of their own kind inside. A few minutes later, they convince one of them to join your crew, and you drop the rest of them off at the nearest station.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart and you collect its wreckage.

deadCrew.text: You've killed all the ship's crew, so you collect everything of value from it.

event.name: HAL_DRONE_HA_LA_VA
event.text: Near the beacon you find a HAL drone. Looks like the ship sustaining it departed, forgetting the drone here. Now you are its owner.

event.name: HAL_QUEST_ESCORT
event.text: At this beacon there is only one ship. Its captain hails you: "We're in great need of assistance. Our FTL Navigation system is damaged. Can you help us get to the nearest station?"
"Excellent. Take this fuel in advance. We'll be right behind you. I'd rather not venture into this dangerous place alone... "
"We understand. You yourselves must have trouble dealing with the hordes of drones."

choice.text: (Advanced FTL Navigation) Send them data of a safe route.

event.text: "You have helped us out immensely with this information!" They send you some supplies as thanks.
You escort the ship to the specified beacon. To your disappointment, you're ambushed by a HAL ship, which uses its first volley from its drones to destroy the Federation ship following you!
Soon after you arrive, the ship you were escorting stops nearby. They thank you for your help and offer a reward.
The ship that you were escorted thanks you: "It's unlikely that we would've made it without your help. Let my friends patch up your hull and give you some scrap."

textList.name: ASTEROID_HAL_FIGHT_TEXT

textList.name: PULSAR_HAL_FIGHT_TEXT

You notice a HAL ship firing at a pulsar with ion weaponry. Finding you, it changes its target.
A HAL drone is prowling around this pulsar. Approaching, it releases its drones upon you.

textList.name: SUN_HAL_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: Near the red-hot star patrols a HAL drone. Seeing you, it immediately attacks.
A HAL drone is prowling about this star. Approaching, it releases its drones on you.
A highly active star nearby burned down several HAL drones. A dangerous situation awaits when another such drone comes to attack you.

textList.name: DISTRESS_HAL_TEXT
textList.text: After jumping to the distress beacon, you immediately notice a Federation ship under fire from a HAL drone. After a couple of seconds, the drones turns its attention to you!
Directly before you, a HAL drone is attacking a helpless Federation transport. Without finishing its assault, the artificial intelligence attacks you...
The distress call was sent by a Federation vessel. A HAL drone is trying to break through its shields with its drones, but your appearance changes its attack priorities — now it's attacking you!

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect everything that survived.

event.text: Looks like the on-board HAL computer has activated backup power circuitry.
Looks like the on-board HAL computer has activated backup power circuitry.
Looks like the on-board HAL computer has activated backup power circuitry.
Looks like the on-board HAL computer has activated backup power circuitry.
Looks like the on-board HAL computer has activated backup power circuitry.

Suddenly, the on-board HAL computer shuts off, and the drone hangs still in space. You wait a while, but everything seems to be in order. Your crew examines their ship for scrap and finds a working HAL drone schematic in the hold.
The ship you defended from the HAL hastily fled the battlefield...
The ship you defended from the HAL fled in an unknown direction...
The ship you defended from the HAL thanks you, however, can only help with information about the sector.
The ship you defended from the HAL burns to the ground. Your current conditions force you to collect everything of value from their ship...
The ship you defended from the HAL thanks you and shares their supplies.

textList.name: DISTRESS_HAL_DESTR_TEXT
textList.text: Arriving at the distress signal, you find still warm wreckage of some ship. You've arrived too late to help whoever put out the call...
You have time to notice a HAL jumping away to another beacon, but it's over. Now all that remains from the drone's victim is some debris, which you've no choice but to pick up.
The civilian vessel that sent the distress signal has been completely destroyed by a recent battle. No one's left alive, so all you can do now is to just take everything of use from their ship.

textList.name: DISTRESS_HAL_TRAP_TEXT
textList.text: Looks like the HAL ships have learned to simulate distress signals in order to lure unsuspecting captains into traps. You've fallen into one such trap!
To your surprise, the distress signal is coming from a HAL drone, but it obviously doesn't need any help — right as you appear, it goes into combat mode!
You were in such a hurry to help out here that you fall into a HAL trap. Unsurprisingly, this AI is able to simulate distress signals.

textList.name: DISTRESS_HAL_EMPTY_TEXT
textList.text: The beacon's empty. During the jump, the distress signal was interrupted, and now you're unable to find its source.
It's strange, but as soon as you arrive here, the distress call disappears...
Your comms equipment must've malfunctioned — you don't find anything at this beacon that could've produced a distress signal.

event.name: LANIUS_HAL
event.text: A Lanius battleship nearby is busy absorbing the debris of some HAL. They don't react to your arrival whatsoever.

choice.text: Attempt to collect some of the debris for yourself.

event.text: The Lanius are forced to stop what they're doing in order to defend themselves.

choice.text: Don't interfere and fly away from here.
(Lanius Crewmember) Let your Lanius try to negotiate with their own kind.

event.text: The Lanius are willing to share part of their loot, and together you dismantle the drone's remains.
As might be expected, the Lanius aren't willing to share with anyone and attack your ship.
You try not to get close to the Lanius ship and collect far flown debris.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a collection of useful scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a collection of useful scrap.
The ship explodes, and part of its metal plating falls off. You're able to collect a considerable amount of scrap.
There are no more life signs remaining on the ship. You pick out useful materials from it.
There are no more life signs remaining on the ship. You pick out useful materials from it.
There are no more life signs remaining on the ship. You pick out useful materials from it.
There are no more life signs remaining on the ship. You pick out useful materials from it.
There are no more life signs remaining on the ship. You pick out useful materials from it.
With the crew dead, you can take out the fuel from their storage. You also collect all available scrap.
Now that the Lanius ship is cleared of enemies, you search it. In the end, you find a prisoner who asks to join your crew.
Бывший пленник приступает к своим новым обязанностям.
За своё спасение он отдаёт вам все ценности, которые у него не забрали.
On the ship, you find a drone schematic. With nobody to stop you, you take it for yourself.
Having finished off the Lanius, you collect all that's left of the HAL ship.
Almost nothing remains from the HAL's wreckage. You take everything that looks useful.

event.name: LANIUS_HAL_HOST
event.text: Right before you, a Lanius ship is busy absorbing the debris of some HAL. After seeing you, they stop what they're doing and go on the attack.

textList.name: PIRATE_HAL
textList.text: A desperate pirate made an ambush in this nebula, and you fell into their trap!
To your surprise, you stumble upon a pirate ship in a nebula. They don't look friendly.
Turns out that in this unfriendly sector pirates sometimes trade. You come across one such ship.
A ship is flying behind the vortices of the nebula. You prepare to fight with the HAL, but it turns out to be pirates!
You didn't expect to stumble upon pirates in this sector, but it happened. Prepare to fight!
In this nebula, the pirates ambushed you. It seems that they're glad that this time they don't have to fight with the HAL.

textList.name: HAL_PIRATE_TEXT
textList.text: Unexpectedly, you are attacked by a pirate cruiser. Do they dare to fly in such a place?
You didn't expect to run into pirates here. But it happened.
A pirate ship is engaged in robbery in this dangerous sector. Seeing you, it immediately starts charging all its weapons.

gotaway.text: The pirate ship made a jump.

event.name: HAL_PIRATE_HELP
event.text: Right before you plays another drama: a HAL drone riddled a pirate ship with holes. It then jumps away, apparently not noticing you. The pirate ship is about to explode, but there's still a chance to save possible survivors.

choice.text: Quickly dock in search of survivors and supplies.
Wait for the ship to explode and safely collect the wreckage of the ship.

event.text: They chose their own fate; pirates needn't be helped. You cold-bloodedly wait for the explosion, and then collect the wreckage.
There were no survivors. You quickly gather what supplies you can find and then leave.
Collecting supplies from the ship, you find a surviving pirate. They say that they will correct themselves and surely serve you.
As soon as you fly closer, part of the ship explodes, damaging your hull! You don't take any further risks and fly away from this dangerous place.
On board, there are indeed survivors. While you were gathering supplies, they made their way to your ship and are now trying to capture it! You fly away while your crew busily deals with the pirates.

event.name: HAL_PIRATE_HELP_END
event.text: After flying away from the ship, you await its explosion, and then collect some debris. It's time to move on — you've already been delayed enough.

event.name: BROKEN_HAL_FIGHT
event.text: Before you flies a wrecked HAL drone with broken shields. Despite the damage, it attacks you.

event.name: BROKEN_HAL_FIGHT_2
event.text: A HAL drone slowly drifts past you. It looks like its engines are broken into rubbish! Despite the damage, it attacks you.

textList.name: BROKEN_HAL_FIGHT_ITS_EASY
textList.text: It should be easy prey.
It's a sitting duck!
This should be a piece of cake.

event.name: HAL_MONOLITH
event.text: Next to your ship hangs motionless a strange black object resembling a perfect parallelepiped with an aspect ratio of 1:4:9. Your sensors cannot determine its internal structure, but there doesn't appear to be any threat coming from it.

choice.text: Send someone from your crew to the monolith.

event.text: Who will risk it?

choice.text: Carefully bring the ship close to the monolith.
Don't touch anything and fly away instead.

event.text: Your crew member approaches the monolith in a small shuttle. As soon as they reach its surface, a bright flash sprays them into molecules...

removeCrew.text: Unfortunately, there's absolutely nothing left of the crewmember from which to make a clone...

event.text: As soon as your crew member touches the surface of the monolith, you notice a new weapon in the hold.
Upon approach, your crew member feels a sharp sensation of heat from the monolith and, worrying for their life, comes back to the ship.
Your crew member touches the surface of the monolith and then returns, filled with knowledge about this sector.

As soon as your crew member approaches the monolith, a phantom copy of your ship flies out from the opposite side of it. Charging the FTL Drive, the ghost ship rushes towards the Rebels. This should delay them significantly.
