You carefully approach the monolith with your ship, but nothing happens... What a useless waste of time!
You carefully approach the monolith with your ship, but suddenly record a rise in on board temperature. You decide it's best to get out of here before conditions worsen.

You carefully approach the monolith with your ship, but suddenly your ship's energy flow changes instantly, partially damaging your ship's plating... You change the course away from the monolith to safety.

You carefully approach the monolith with your ship, and the monolith's surface covers with trembling ripples. Suddenly you start to be dragged inside, right into an infinite void! The engines roar at maximum power, trying to pull you of the trap, but they seem to have absolutely no effect whatsoever...
You carefully approach the monolith with your ship and notice how the ship's hull damage completely vanishes due to some unknown force.
You open fire, but your projectiles don't do any damage. They just get endlessly absorbed by its abyssal surface...

As soon as the first projectile reaches the surface of the monolith, everything around is suddenly distorted and you find yourself in the midst of some quiet nebula... The Rebel Fleet will need some time to find you again.
You open fire, and in response, energy flows fly out from the monolith's surface, burning out part of the ship...

The first hit causes the monolith to crumble into a heap of debris, and you wonder if the monolith was really that fragile, or if it just looked like it crumbled. Nevertheless there's still debris, and you quickly collect as much as possible.

event.name: HAL_ENGI_MANTIS
event.text: You stumble upon something hard to believe: an Engi ship under Mantis control and armed with HAL drones! The Mantis must've hunted well... and now they're attacking you!

textList.name: START_BEACON_BORDER
textList.text: At the moment, fierce battles rage on in this sector. Hunters for easy money are always ready to attack large ships weakened by large-scale collisions.
This sector is controlled with varying success by the Rebel forces and the Federation. Other races that have found themselves in the neighborhood always want to plunder the defeated ships.
This sector is in close proximity to sectors of different races. Here the main battles between the Rebels and the Federation unfold.
This sector is inhabited by representatives of all known races. The main front line of the war with the Rebels also passes here, and the locals are not that enthusiastic about this...
Representatives of all known races managed to get along in this part of the Galaxy until the war with the Rebels reached here. Now it's every race for themselves.
Before you is the border sector. Once it was the center of trade between different races, now here are the main battles of the Rebels and the Federation.

event.text: The beacon's entrance is controlled by Federation forces. Upon learning of your assignment, they offer you some supplies.
The beacon's entrance is controlled by the Rebels — you don't have time to use the ship's augments for special purposes!

textList.name: ZOLTON_FIGHT_BORDER
textList.text: A Zolton ship makes contact. "The nature of the day is rotational. The fever is emaciated. The reason is-" They've caught some nasty deep space dementia. Before you can consider finding help for them, they open fire.
For some reason, the Zoltons' incoming ship mistakes you for enemies. They confusedly attack you.
The usually peace-loving Zoltons behave oddly this time around. They walk about their ship, periodically cycling the power of random systems, before pointing their weapon array at you!

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_EMPTY_TEXT
textList.text: In the distance, you see a large-scale battle whose participants, apparently, don't notice you. You don't dare to interfere and prepare to jump.
You appear at the next beacon. Not a soul around, it seems, ships rarely appear here. After a short rest from the horrors of war, you further plot how you'll navigate your route through this sector.
You arrive at the beacon. Countless battles in this sector have amazed your crew with their scale. The Rebels must pay with their lives for what they've done.
Near this beacon it's surprisingly quiet and peaceful. You carefully study the surroundings while the FTL Drive charges.
Among the chaos of this sector, you manage to find a relatively quiet place where you can catch your breath.

textList.name: STORE_BORDER_1_TEXT
textList.text: This beacon is welded to an automated trade station. Surprisingly, it still works...
The automated trade station at this beacon looks tattered, but still functions.
On this beacon there's a Federation trade station. It's protected from the Rebels by several well-armed cruisers.

event.text: Approaching Rebels fire at you from a distance.

choice.text: (Improved Engines) Break away from their pursuit.
(Advanced Engines) Break away from their pursuit.

event.text: The power of your engines is enough to not engage in risky skirmishes with the Rebels.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_PDS_BAD_TEXT
textList.text: Immediately upon arrival to this beacon, fire is opened on you from a nearby planet, and the nearest Rebel ship is turning in your direction.
This beacon is controlled by the Rebels, and you're under fire by an ASB! The patrolling ship, meanwhile, hurries to their aid.
You appear right in the middle of a Rebel military camp. The patrol ship notices you flies to intercept, and an anti-ship battery helps them!

event.text: The power of your engines is enough to not engage in risky skirmishes with the Rebels.
You just can't tear yourself away, and approaching Rebels fire at you from a distance.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you quickly collect scrap under the fire of the ASB.

deadCrew.text: You killed all the crew off and hastily clean out their holds. The planet doesn't stop firing at you in the meantime.

textList.name: ORDEN_BORDER_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: The beacon is completely empty, except for an Order cruiser, who, just after seeing you, immediately goes on the attack.
"To the glory of Chaos!" is the only thing you hear as soon as you appear at the beacon. An Order Cruiser is attacking you!
A lone Order ship patrols this beacon. You try to contact them, but they reject the request, while charging up their weapons.
You appeared too close to an Order cruiser, and the communicator's able to catch a scrap of a message from their ship: "...where did you come from... Chaos shall swallow you!"
At the exit of the beacon awaits an Order battlecruiser. The satisfied smirk of their captain on the video screen doesn't bode well: "Now you will know the full power of Chaos!"

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_PDS_CHAOS_TEXT
textList.text: Right before your very eyes, a Rebel ship destroys a civilian ship, then goes to you! From the surface of the planet, civilians open an indiscriminate fire. Apparently, their aiming systems are damaged, and they're firing at random!

You get directly to the center of the next battle — a Rebel ship is attacking a civilian settlement, and they respond with ASB volleys. Seeing you, the Rebels change target, but shots from the planet don't subside. They're firing at you too!

You're in a hurry to help the civilian settlement which Rebels are attacking. Either they're too frightened, or their guidance system leaves much to be desired — the Rebel cruiser's under bombardment, but so are you!

escape.text: The communicator manages to intercept the following: "Damn! We'll soon break apart! Get out of here!"

gotaway.text: The Rebel ship jumped in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect scrap, all the while dodging fire from the planet.

deadCrew.text: You killed the crew and cleaned their holds, all the whil dodging fire from the planet.

choice.text: Attack one of the Rebel ships.

event.text: There's no time to cool down, our allies need help. Attack!
You can't believe what you're doing, but your ship's turning in the opposite direction. Your mission is too important to risk it.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_TWO_FLEET_FIGHT_TEXT
textList.text: You've arrived at the next place of battle. The conflict between the Federation and the Rebel fleet has developed quite close to you.
You're in close proximity to a major battle between the Federation fleet and the Rebels. Stray shells fly everywhere, but you haven't been noticed yet.
Right before you there's a large-scale clash between the Federation and the Rebels. Missiles flying past barely miss your ship's hull.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_TWO_FLEET_FIGHT_LEAVE
textList.text: Abandon your allies to the mercy of fate.
Leave your allies to fend for themselves.

escape.text: You hear the following from the communicator: "Retreat!"

gotaway.text: The Rebel ship jumped in an unknown direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect all the scrap that remains.

deadCrew.text: You killed the crew, so you clean out their holds.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_FLEET_FED_TEXT
textList.text: This beacon has a Federation fleet. They provide you supplies without question and continue to prepare for battle.
The Federation fleet at this beacon identifies your ship and supplies you with, well, supplies. Thanking them, you fly onwards.
You appear in a Federation camp. Any allied ship will receive assistance here.
You're right in the middle of a Federation camp. They send you some supplies.

textList.name: BORDER_STUFF_TEXT
textList.text: Right before you are traces of a small battle; among the wreckage you find something of use.
Before you are the remains of a Federation cruiser. There are a few supplies left on board.
Before you are the remains of a Rebel cruiser. There are a few supplies left on board.

textList.name: BORDER_RANDOM_STANDARD_TEXT
textList.text: You discover a destroyed Federation base. Inside, there remains something of value.
You discover a destroyed Rebel base. Inside, there remains something of value.
Right before you are traces of a large-scale battle. Among the wreckage, you're able to find something of use.

event.text: You can't allow innocent ships to suffer as a result of the fighting. You fly towards the Rebels, warming up the weapons.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Try to slip through unnoticed, using your cloak.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_FLEET_REBEL_TEXT
textList.text: The onboard radar shows a large accumulation of ships far ahead of you. The Rebels are detaining civilian vessels in order to clarify their involvement with the Federation. Their scouts haven't noticed you yet.
Ahead of you is a Rebel border outpost. They're checking every civilian vessel to find if they belong to the Federation.
Directly ahead of you is a large cluster of civilian ships. The Rebels staged a checkpoint here and are checking every ship for their involvement with the Federation.

event.text: You manage to bypass the radars of the enemy ship and successfully leave the dangerous area. Communicating with the Rebels now isn't the best idea.
You try not to attract the attention of the scouts, but their radars still intercept you, and they open fire.
You try not to attract the attention of the scouts, but their radars still intercept you, and they open fire.
You manage to bypass the radars of the enemy ship and successfully leave the dangerous area. Communicating with the Rebels now isn't the best idea.
You manage to bypass the radars of the enemy ship and successfully leave the dangerous area. Communicating with the Rebels now isn't the best idea.
You try not to attract the attention of the scouts, but their radars still intercept you, and they open fire.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect all the scrap that remains.

event.text: The civilian ships thank you and send you resources before flying through the new gap in the Rebel checkpoint.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead, you clean out their holds.

event.text: The civilian ships thank you and send you resources before flying through the new gap in the Rebel checkpoint.

textList.name: BORDER_SECTOR_PDS_FED_TEXT
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon under the control of the Federation, but right after you a Rebel ship jumps here. This is quite a desperate maneuver on their part.
This beacon is under the control of Federation forces. Suddenly, a Rebel scout appears behind you.
You appear near a Federation camp. As soon as you breathe a sigh of relief, a Rebel cruiser appears, apparently not expecting to be surrounded by enemies.

gotaway.text: The Rebel ship jumped away in the opposite direction.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you collect what remains.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead, you clean out their holds.

textList.name: IDIOT_REBEL_SHIPS_TEXT
textList.text: From the communicator you hear: "Oops, it seems we were mistaken by a beacon, don't fire, we're already flying away!"
The Rebels hail: "Oh, this beacon belongs to the Federation? Okay, we'll meet some other time."
You hear swearing aboard the Rebel ship in the general comms channel: "I told you, you had to jump in the other direction!" They're trying to get away.
You hear swearing aboard the Rebel ship in the general comms channel: "I told you this wasn't a trading post!" Now they're trying to escape.

event.text: Your allies thank you for your help and send over some supplies.
Your allies thank you for your help and send a repair crew to patch up your ship.

event.name: MISSILE_RADIATION_EVENT
event.text: You notice a huge missile near the beacon. It clearly launched off the nearby planet and is heading for some other beacon. In the meantime, the planet's opening fire in your direction.

escape.text: You notice energy growing within the FTL Drive of this missile! A crewman meanwhile detects dangerous radiation emanating from the missile.

gotaway.text: The missile made an FTL jump.

destroyed.text: A horrific explosion shakes the space nearby and damages your ship. Several fragments from the missile get stuck in the ship's hull. Perhaps it was better to let the missile fly away. You console yourself with the thought that you saved someone's life or perhaps even an entire colony...

event.name: SHIP_WITH_BIG_MISSILE_EVENT
event.text: Unexpectedly, a pirate ship appears next to you, but doesn't look that dangerous, except for in one detail that makes you worry...

destroyed.text: The pirate ship is destroyed; they won't bother anyone else. You collect debris from the battlefield.

deadCrew.text: All the pirates are dead; they won't bother anyone else. You clean out their holds.

textList.name: AVATAR_SHIPS_BORDER_LIST
textList.text: Watch out — a military Avatar ship. Any attempts to settle the situation by negotiations will be fruitless — they're unable to communicate with other races.
An Avatar battleship awaits careless travelers at this beacon. You have no choice but to prepare your defenses.
Near the beacon is a patrolling ship under AI control. Seeing you, it immediately goes on the offensive.
Another unremarkable beacon in front of you, and you've already given the order to leave it when suddenly an AI ship appears directly ahead. Prepare to fight!

event.name: SLURM_FIGHT_BORDER
event.text: The Sligs rarely leave their home nebulae, but sometimes they go in search of rare ingredients for Slurm. You stumble upon one such ship, and they're not friendly...

event.name: ENGI_SHIP_BORDER
event.text: In this sector, even the Engi are trying to kill you! You order the crew to maintain your defenses.

textList.name: CRYSTAL_FIGHT_BORDER
textList.text: You emerge near a flotilla of Crystalline ships, civilian or commercial by the looks of them. You stay around a bit to scan them, but they immediately react and send a guardship at you to defend themselves. Prepare to fight!

You arrive at the beacon and get immediately greeted by an automated message or some kind of alert. The translator's unable to make out its meaning, but after a few moments of anxiety a hostile ship jumps in right towards you!
You receive a message: "Ha. Looks like another useless vessel full of aliens. Prepare to meet your maker!" You find that an enemy's weapons are aimed right at you.

A stream of grindings and clicks is broadcast through the transmitter. The universal interpreter understands just a bit of it, but the words "outsiders", "allowed", and "not" are heard quite distinctly. You'll have to prove your right to be here in battle.

event.name: DISTRESS_BORDER_TRADERS
event.text: The trade station at this beacon urgently needs help — the Rebels are trying to destroy and plunder it!
You rush to the aid of the merchants.

choice.text: We don't have time for this...

destroyed.text: With the Rebels destroyed, the grateful civilians ask you to visit their store.

deadCrew.text: With the Rebels killed off, the grateful civilians ask you to visit their store.

event.name: BORDER_DISTRESS_TWO_FLEET_FIGHT
event.text: Arriving at the distress signal, you immediately find yourself in the center of a large-scale battle! Shells fly around, mines are exploding, several ships explode right before your eyes... You try to keep yourself aloof, but a desperate Rebel has already set their sights on your ship.

destroyed.text: You quickly collect the debris and prepare to leave this dangerous place.

deadCrew.text: You quickly clean out their ship and prepare to leave this dangerous place.

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY
event.text: The Federation battlecruiser hails: "Thanks for responding to our distress call! We're running out of ammunition, can we have some spare missiles?"
You send them your missiles.

choice.text: Apologize saying you don't have extra missiles.

event.text: They understand everything and wish you good luck.

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY_2
event.text: "Thank you! This will help us very much in the upcoming battle! Maybe you also have a few drone parts to spare?"
You send them your drone parts.

choice.text: Apologize saying you don't have any spare drone parts.

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY_3
event.text: "Great! Maybe you have more fuel tanks, too?"
You send them your fuel.

choice.text: No! We've already given you enough supplies!

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY_2_REWARD
event.text: "No problem, thanks for that! Here, take this for your help." They send you some scrap.

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY_3_REWARD
event.text: "Take it easy, Captain, no need to get so excited! We'll pay you with some scrap, don't worry!" They send you the promised metal and quickly fly away.

event.name: BORDER_SUPPLY_REWARD
event.text: "Thank you, Captain! Now we'll show these Rebels!" As a token of gratitude, they send you a scrap mountain and an augmentation for the ship.

event.name: BORDER_FED_TRAP
event.text: You arrive at the disaster site and meet a Federation cruiser. It doesn't look like they need any help. Soon they hail: "It's all right, captain! We sent a distress signal to lure gullible Rebels. As soon as they appear here, they'll immediately receive a missile salvo aboard, ha-ha-ha!" They share supplies with you, and you thank them and move on.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP
event.text: You meet a Federation battlecruiser, and they hail: "How fortunate that we've met one of our own! Our positions in this part of the sector are captured by the Rebels, and we're looking for someone who'll help us fight them off."

choice.text: Sorry, we don't have time for this.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP_ACCEPT
event.text: "Now the primary task is to regain control of the repair shipyard and the trade station. According to our intelligence, there are Elite Rebel Cruisers patrolling. Where will you go?"

choice.text: Say that you're willing to clean up both points.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP_DOCK
event.text: "Well, let's not waste time! Here are the coordinates of the shipyard, and we'll go to the station." After transmitting the coordinates to you, they jump away.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP_TRADERS
event.text: "Well, let's not waste time! Here are the coordinates of the station, and we'll go to the shipyard." After transmitting the coordinates to you, they jump away.
"There isn't enough time! If the Rebellion's main forces show up, we won't be able to deal with them. We must split up: you'll go to one of the beacons, and we'll go to the other."
They seem doubtful about your weaponry. "Well, we'll transmit you the coordinates and keep and eye on you. Good luck." You get the coordinates of the first target.
You get the coordinates of the second target.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP_DOCK_QUEST
event.text: You arrive at the repair yard. The patrolling Elite Rebel Cruiser immediately attacks you.

destroyed.text: You gather the wreckage of the cruiser and contact the shipyard personnel.

event.text: They thank you for rescuing them and repair up your ship, while also optimizing your shields' performance.
They thank you for rescuing them and repair up your ship. They were going to upgrade your shields, but seeing as you have none, they send over a bit of scrap.

deadCrew.text: You search the cruiser's holds and contact the shipyard personnel.

event.text: They thank you for rescuing them and repair up your ship, while also optimizing your shields' performance.
They thank you for rescuing them and repair up your ship. They were going to upgrade your shields, but seeing as you have none, they send over a bit of scrap.

event.name: BORDER_NEED_HELP_TRADERS_QUEST
event.text: You arrive at the trade station. The patrolling Elite Rebel Cruiser immediately attacks you.

destroyed.text: You gather the wreckage of the cruiser and contact the station personnel.

event.text: They thank you for rescuing them and hand over some stocks of scrap, and also take you to the store.

deadCrew.text: You search the cruiser's holds and contact the station personnel.

event.text: They thank you for rescuing them and hand over some stocks of scrap, and also take you to the store.

textList.name: BORDER_ELITE_HOSTILE
textList.text: You suddenly find yourself right next to an Elite Rebel Cruiser. To battle!
You stumble upon a patrolling Rebel Cruiser. Prepare to fight!
An Elite Rebel Cruiser patrols this beacon. Seeing you, it immediately goes on the offensive.
Right on top of you is an Elite Rebel Cruiser. Another instant more, and you'd have collided, but your pilot makes an evasive maneuver just in time.
Apparently this beacon is controlled by Rebels — you're happily met by one of their Elite Cruisers.
The Rebels took control of this beacon! An Elite Cruiser is ready to crush you.

destroyed.text: You gather the cruiser's wreckage.

deadCrew.text: You search the cruiser's holds.

event.name: BORDER_BATTLE_HELP
event.text: Before you is a Federation cruiser, and evidently they're in a hurry to get somewhere. You ask to connect into their channel: "Quick! Not enough time! We need reinforcements, fly behind us."

choice.text: Sorry, we don't have time for this.

event.name: BORDER_BATTLE_HELP_ACCEPT
event.text: "Excellent, catch these coordinates and some supplies." Passing you the coordinates, they jump towards the battle.

event.name: BORDER_BATTLE_HELP_QUEST
event.text: The large-scale battle is in full swing. You choose a target, avoiding stray shells along the way.

destroyed.text: The ship breaks apart, and you scrap what remains of it.

deadCrew.text: With the crew dead, you clean out the ship's holds.

event.text: The battle gradually subsides, and the beacon's in Federation hands. Your allies thank you for your help and send some supplies.
The battle gradually subsides, and the beacon's in Federation hands. Your allies thank you for your help and send you an extra weapon they have.

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_QUEST
event.text: An enterprising trader appears before you. "Greetings! I have a special offer for you, for a modest 40 scrap, I'll get you any weapon you want. Money up front!"
It's not in your rules to deal with pirates.

choice.text: We don't make deals on questionable conditions.

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_QUEST_CHOICE
event.text: The trader quietly hides the scrap in their vault. "What kind of weapon do you want? Lasers? Beam? Or maybe Ion?"

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_LASERS
event.text: "Excellent! Meet you at these coordinates!" They send you the coordinates of the venue and immediately jump away. But you didn't even discuss the specific model of the weapon, what the heck?!

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_BEAMS
event.text: "Excellent! Meet you at these coordinates!" They send you the coordinates of the venue and immediately jump away. But you didn't even discuss the specific model of the weapon, what the heck?!

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_IONS
event.text: "Excellent! Meet you at these coordinates!" They send you the coordinates of the venue and immediately jump away. But you didn't even discuss the specific model of the weapon, what the heck?!

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_LASERS_QUEST
event.text: In front of you is the very same enterprising trader, looking somewhat annoyed. "How long must I wait for you? I have many other orders besides yours... just take what you asked for." They then quickly jettison the cargo off their port bow and quickly fly away.

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_BEAMS_QUEST
event.text: In front of you is the very same enterprising trader, looking somewhat annoyed. "How long must I wait for you? I have many other orders besides yours... just take what you asked for." They then quickly jettison the cargo off their port bow and quickly fly away.

event.name: BORDER_PIRATE_IONS_QUEST
event.text: In front of you is the very same enterprising trader, looking somewhat annoyed. "How long must I wait for you? I have many other orders besides yours.. just take what you asked for." They then quickly jettison the cargo off their port bow and quickly fly away.

event.name: NEBULA_BORDER_WITH_PDS
event.text: Right in front of you, silhouettes of Rebel ships flash through the nebula. You can't accurately determine how many there are, but clearly there's more than one.

choice.text: Attack the ship closest to you.

event.text: You enter into a gunfight with a slightly straggling Rebel, but you start to get shelled at by Rebels hidden in the nebula!

choice.text: Don't take any chances and hide in the nebula.

event.text: You clear-mindedly assess your capabilities and decide to wait until the Rebels fly away.

destroyed.text: You quickly gather the wreckage while under fire from the hidden Rebels. Fortunately, they don't risk coming out of hiding.

deadCrew.text: You quickly clean out the ship's holds while under fire from the hidden Rebels. Fortunately, they don't risk coming out of hiding.

event.name: NEBULA_BORDER_WITH_PDS2
event.text: You watch as a Federation cruiser pursues a Rebel ship at the border of the nebula. Another moment, and the Rebels disappear into a dense cloud. Your allies hail: "Help us track down the bastards. We wounded them, but they're still dangerous."

choice.text: Agree to track down the Rebels.
Apologize and say that you're busy.

event.text: Their captain makes a contemptuous grimace, disconnects and directs their ship into the nebula.
After a few minutes of surveillance, you stumble upon the hiding Rebels, and a gunfight ensues. Your ally helps you, shelling the Rebels from another part of the nebula.

Your allies are the first to find the hiding Rebels, and the battle begins. You help them from afar by shelling the Rebels from another part of the nebula. Soon the Rebels are finished, and you divide the wreckage of their ship.
Despite your joint efforts, the Rebels manage to escape. You say goodbye to your allies and part ways.

destroyed.text: You collect the wreckage of the ship, leaving a bit for your ally.

deadCrew.text: You clean out the Rebels ship's holds, leaving a bit for your ally.

event.name: NEBULA_BORDER_WITH_PDS3
event.text: The beacon is enveloped in a vast cloud of the nebula, and visibility is almost zero. Suddenly a laser projectile rushes past you.

You appeared too close to another battle between the Federation and the Rebels, and one of the Rebels has already aimed their weapons at you! From the nebula now and then artillery shells from other ships fly out.

event.name: BORDER_REBEL_MINER
event.text: A small Rebel minership is mining metal in this asteroid field. You notice an unusual weapon they use to split large asteroids in half. The miners are so keen on mining that they don't notice you.
The Rebels are too late, now they will not escape your grasp!

choice.text: Too dangerous, get out of here.

escape.text: Looks like they don't want to fight and are trying to escape.

destroyed.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a useful pile of scrap.

deadCrew.text: You grab all the scrap you can manage.

event.text: Unfortunately, their unusual beam weapon exploded with the ship. It's time to go.
Their unusual beam weapon wasn't damaged in the battle, so you take it for yourself.

event.name: MINER_BEEM_REWARD_2
event.text: Their unusual beam weapon wasn't damaged in the battle, so you take it for yourself.

event.name: BORDER_FED_MINER
event.text: A small civilian ship mines metal in this asteroid field. You notice an unusual weapon they use to split large asteroids in half. The miners are so keen on mining that they don't notice you.
You hope that no one will find traces of your crime in this dangerous place.

Upon learning that you're flying to Federation headquarters on an important mission, they give you whatever resources they can spare. You part ways with them, saying goodbye and wishing each other good luck.

Upon learning that you're flying to Federation headquarters on an important mission, they give you whatever resources they can spare. You part ways with them, saying goodbye and wishing each other good luck.
Upon learning that you're flying to Federation headquarters on an important mission, they give you a spare weapon of theirs. You part ways with them, saying goodbye and wishing each other good luck.

escape.text: Looks like they don't want to fight and are trying to escape.

gotaway.text: Damnit, they've managed to get away!

destroyed.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a useful collection of scrap material.

deadCrew.text: You take all the scrap they managed to collect.

event.name: BORDER_PANIC
event.text: You appear in the middle of a Federation camp. Suddenly a panicked patrol ship starts to shoot at you with its entire weapon array.
A few seconds later they realize their mistake, but the ship has already taken damage...
They apologize and send a repair squad out to help you. "Sorry about that, our nerves have taken a beating these past few days... This war is terrible. Take some scrap with you as compensation."

event.name: BORDER_REPAIR
event.text: You find yourself in a Federation camp. The ships here are all in poor condition — recently there was a major clash with the Rebels, and the allies struggled to fight back. Now they are preparing to fly out to a repair station. You learn from them its coordinates.

choice.text: (Repair Arm) Ask them if your repair arm can be of service.

event.text: Your crane manages to repair some of the more damaged ships. "Thank you, without your help, we would hardly have reached the station. Here, take all that we have."

event.name: BORDER_REPAIR_QUEST
event.text: You arrive at the repair station. Allied Federation ships receive free maintenance here, as well as some supplies.

event.name: BORDER_WHO_ARE_YOU
event.text: You encounter a Federation vessel and establish video communication with them. The captain and their assistants are shown on screen, showing visible laser damage on their faces. "What do you want?" Hurry, we need to know the location of the enemy's ships.

choice.text: Give them details of your route so far.
Tell them about your mission and ask for help.
Ask what happened to them, as seen by their faces.

event.text: "The Rebels tried to take our craft by boarding, but we fought back." The captain looks a bit nervous, or so you think?

choice.text: Ask them to name a secret Federation password.
(Slug Crewmember) Let your Slug examine the captain's thoughts.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Give them scanner data on the nearby beacons.

event.text: They thank you for the information and share some supplies.
You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. "Perhaps this will help us, thank you." They send you some scrap in gratitude.
You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. "Unfortunately, this data is insufficient, but thanks anyway." They give you a bit of scrap in gratitude.
Their captain mutters something about gratitude and disconnects in a huff. You shrug your shoulders and give the order to get ready to jump.
Finding out who you are, their captain looks shocked and then says something to their assistants. Suddenly, communication breaks off, and their weapns are aimed at you. They were Rebels in disguise!

Finding out who you are, their captain perks up and then says something to their assistants. "We'll request reinforcements from our nearest outpost for you. And now I'm sorry, we've got to go." They jump towards the Rebel Fleet, and they noticeably approach your location. They were Rebels in disguise!
The captain relaxes: "We could use your route data." You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. They thank you and send a bunch of scrap for your help.
The captain relaxes: "We could use your route data." You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. They thank you and send scrap for your help.
"We can handle ourselves" — they abruptly cut off communication. Well, they'll get by. You give the order to jump.

The captain delays for a moment: "Uh... we are united!" Realizing how stupid they sound, the captain quickly disconnects. Just as you thought, these are Rebels in disguise, and now they will pay for their treachery!

"Password? What password?" — They look at you uncomprehendingly. You say that it was all a test, and their entire crew bursts into laughter. "You need to trust your own!" They send you supplies to smooth out their embarrassment.
The Slug whispers to you that these are in fact Rebels who have boarded your allies and changed into their uniforms. You don't like this captain one bit, prepare to fight!
The Slug whispers to you that they are indeed telling the truth. You ask the captain, "How can we be of service?"
The captain relaxes: "We could use your route data." You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. They thank you and send a bunch of scrap for your help.
The captain relaxes: "We could use your route data." You send them your route data, on which you flew to get thus far. They thank you and send scrap for your help.

event.name: BORDER_SECTOR_SUR
event.text: Right in front of you is a battered Rebel ship, clearly not up for a fight. They hail: "Take this scrap, and we'll both pretend this meeting never happened."

choice.text: We don't negotiate with Rebels; to battle!

event.text: Their captain wearily sighs and switches off communications.

choice.text: Well, accept their offer just this one time.

event.text: Their captain breathes a sigh of relief and orders their crew to give you scrap.

event.name: BORDER_REBEL_PREIGNITE
event.text: As soon as you appear a volley from a Single-Charge Installation flies right past you! Where did the Rebels get such weaponry?!

destroyed.text: The explosion destroys the salvo installlation, what a pity...

deadCrew.text: With the Rebels dead, you're free to search their holds.

event.text: Among other stuff you find a Single-Charge Installation, which you take for yourself.
